title: Patient Name
instruction: Extract the patientâ€™s full name exactly as it appears in the transcript.

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: Provide only the chief complaint without additional details.

title: HPI Spencer
content: Precious presents with left wrist pain that wakes her at night. She also reports two masses: one at the dorsal radial aspect of her left wrist and another at the dorsal ulnar aspect of her left thumb MCP joint. These masses have been constant in size recently. She saw a rheumatologist who performed X-rays and an ultrasound, but no definitive diagnosis was made. The pain is more bothersome than the masses, and she seeks treatment options.
instruction: Summarize the HPI as a single paragraph.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Left upper extremity skin is clean, dry, and intact. A pea-sized mass over the first dorsal compartment is mobile and non-tender. Another mass at the thumb MCP joint is non-mobile and minimally tender. No tenderness or issues with Finklestein's test; excellent range of motion.

title: Imaging Results
content: X-rays show an osteophyte at the thumb MCP joint. Ultrasound indicates a retinacular cyst in the wrist and a bony avulsion fragment or osteophyte at the thumb MCP.

title: Plan
content: Recommend night splints for carpal tunnel.
instruction: List the doctor's plan as dictated.
